intro: Cryptocarya longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to eastern Australia, particularly found in the rainforests of Queensland and New South Wales. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a dry, woody capsule that contains several seeds. Cryptocarya longifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
